issue.description: I think that the name of the type is confusing. In other modules I have named extended selects abbrev_orig where abrrev is an abbreviation based on the module name that is extending the select and orig is the name of the select being extended. E.g. "ap239_props_classification_item"
I think that the select should be based on ap239_mri_classification_item rather than classification_item. That way it reflects the USE FROM tree.
I'm not sure about the naming of these types. See issue RBN-1

The select type documented_element_select should be extended here to include Assigned_property, Independent_property and Independent_property_relationship - to allow, for example, a source document for a property to be recorded.
The select and classification_item should be extended to include: Uncertainty_with_unit, Unit, context_dependent_unit, activity_property

comment.description: Accept for Uncertainty_with_unit, Unit, context_dependent_unit. Activity_property is instead extended in Characterized_activity_arm per communication with Rob.

issue.description: Extend classification_assignment.items to include Unit and Value_with_unit.
Extend the properties module in order to allow a property to be represented by a probability.

comment.description: Reject. Probability now maps to representation so no change necessary .

issue.description: How should a value of probability be described (in the ARM)? We do have a probability rep item - but this only gets brought in with risk which will now no longer be in the first draft of the AP.

comment.description: Reject. Probabilities should be represented as described in the Probability and Probability_distribution modules/ They were moved into plcs_bp3 so as to be in ed1 of plcs. NOTE these modules use ratio_unit where units are required. Logical values are conditions.

issue.description: It is currently possible to represent numerical values with unit and string values. The representation of values without units, of booleans, logicals, and binaries seem to be missing.

comment.description: With reference to the e-mail discussion - we do have a concrete need to represent logical values (true, false, unknown), but not binaries. Binary was only mentioned for the sake of completeness. Our interest is (in the first place) the ARM model.

Reject. Accept in principle, but representing logic values as first class data types require a new integrated resource is out of scope for plcs first edition. Use String_representation_item (maps to descriptive_representation_item)

issue.description: Attribute_classification.classified_entity It is currently not possible to classify attributes of entity Unit as Unit is not in the select-type Classified_attribute_select. It seems, however, useful to classify the names of units, such as metre, and inch.

A property (length, weight, ...) should be defined once to be available for reuse. Assigned_property does not seem to be suited for this purpose: it is to assign an individual value, but gives also a name to the property. Applied_independent_property seems to provide the concept of a reusable property type. On the other hand we were advised not to use it for this purpose. The definition of Independent_property is rather poor: "An Independent_property is a type of property. " Provide in an introduction to the ARM or in an usage guide annex guidance on how to populate types of properties independent of their values

comment.description: Reject. Accept in principle but there is not time to write a complete usage guide for 1292. Any changes to 1036 will need to be submitted as SEDS against that document.

issue.description: Numerical_item_with_units and Numerical_representation_context entity data types have an attribute to specify one (or several) Units. To specify a single property value it is, thus, necessary to reference the same Unit twice. This may lead to errors (no rule seems to ensure consistency). Ensure that there can not be any conflict between the units referenced by these two entity data types.

comment.description: Accept. No change required to this module but SEDS submitted for 10303-1118
